The Moneyweb business news site reported that there were “approximately 48,000 potholes” in Johannesburg roads, according to the Johannesburg Roads Agency.
But the city’s municipal government estimates there are 100,000 potholes, and the roads agency said it planned to fix nearly 141,000 of them – although it missed this target.
It’s difficult to say exactly how many potholes there are in Joburg, but there are certainly many more than 48,000.
Complaining about potholes is a local pastime for Johannesburg residents. Hop onto Twitter, for example, and you’ll find photos of pockmarked roads in Roodepoort, Fordsburg, Bryanston and Soweto.
